alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Jackson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 21 at 7:41PM CDT until June 21 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Jackson County in east central Iowa... Northern Clinton County in east central Iowa... * Until 815 PM CDT. * At 741 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Elwood, or near Maquoketa, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Delmar and Welton around 750 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Charlotte, Spragueville, Preston, Van Buren, Goose Lake, Miles, Bryant and Elvira. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
